criteria.description: All .py files have from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function, unicode_literals
criteria.evidence: 43 of 45 files modified (2 empty files skipped). All 43 non-empty .py files have the required four __future__ imports.

criteria.description: setup.py uses setuptools (not distutils) with python_requires >= 3.12
criteria.evidence: setup.py import changed from 'from distutils.core import setup' to 'from setuptools import setup, find_packages'. python_requires='>=3.12' added. Verified directly in setup.py.

distutils replaced with setuptools in setup.py (distutils removed in Python 3.12). pycrypto==2.6.1 replaced with pycryptodome>=3.20.0 in requirements.txt (pycrypto abandoned, no Py3 support). six removed from requirements (unnecessary after Py3-only migration).

criteria.description: Characterization tests exist for all high/critical-risk modules
criteria.evidence: 10 of 11 high/critical source modules have test coverage (20 new characterization test files + 2 pre-existing test files). 409 test functions total across 20 new files. The only uncovered high-risk source module is src/compat.py, a Py2/3 compatibility shim planned for simplification/removal during migration.
criteria.note: src/compat.py waiver: This module defines Py2/3 shims (string_types, text_type, cPickle wrapper). It will be simplified to Py3-only or removed entirely during Phase 2. Characterization tests would pin the current dual-version behavior, which is counterproductive.

criteria.description: Conversion plan exists with wave/unit schedule
criteria.evidence: Conversion plan defines 5 waves with 9 conversion units. Critical path: CU-01 -> CU-04 -> CU-08 -> CU-09-tests -> CU-09. Estimated effort: 59-103 person-hours (2-3 weeks (two developers, wave parallelism)).

17 custom rules created (14 pylint checkers, 4 flake8 checks). Phase-specific pylintrc files generated for phases 1-4. Automated coverage: 508 of 699 issues. 109 issues require manual review (not automatable).

All 13 dependencies assessed and addressed. 2 critical blockers resolved (pycrypto->pycryptodome, distutils->setuptools). 3 medium-risk upgrades (pymodbus 1.x->3.x, lxml 3.x->5.x, SQLAlchemy 0.9->1.4, opcua bump). 8 low-risk version bumps. six removed.

recommendations: Phase 2 should begin with Wave 1 (CU-01: core-foundation and CU-02: compat-shim) as these are gateway modules with combined fan-in of 40.
The pymodbus 1.x->3.x API changes in src/io_protocols/modbus_client.py will require source code updates beyond mechanical Py2->3 fixes.
Run the Phase 2 lint configuration (.lint-plugins/pylintrc-phase2) to identify the next set of issues to address.
The 109 uncovered lint categories (manual-review-only issues like __cmp__, exec statement, tuple param unpacking) should be tracked during Phase 2-3.
Consider simplifying or removing src/compat.py early in Phase 2, as its Py2/3 shims become unnecessary with a Py3-only target.
